lines.text: Chow time, Doc.
So, what are we having this evening? Lobster florentine. Beef wellington. Perhaps grilled ahi on a bed of Belgian endive.
No, your old favorite, Doc.
I hate meat loaf!
You wouldn't know a plan if it was pounded up your ass with a jackhammer.
We have some plans, why don't you let us take care of things for awhile?
Mr. Durant, you have revolutionized the right to bear arms.
In this case, the far right to bear arms.

[to Darkman]
I knew you'd come after me. All I had to do was dangle the right bait in front of what's left of your nose.
[revealing Darkman's face]
Aren't you the pretty one?
Life isn't cheap in the city. Death is. When every 12-year old is packing heat, death is cheap. What does that tell you?
The cartoons are too violent?
It tells you I've been away too long!

[about Dr. Brinkman]
Do you want me to make him the usual offer?
lines.character: Rollo Latham, Durant Henchman & CEO Inter-City Land Development

lines.text: I don't think we should attract too much attention to ourselves, Rollo, why don't you try money instead?
I hope you saved room for dessert.
You drive a hard bargain.
Dr. Hathaway, I presume.
Dr. Brinkman, I presume.

[playing with remote controlled rat, making it scare his cat]
Be careful - he bites!
Be careful - he bites!
[detonates explosives rigged on remote controlled rat, destroying Durant's car with him in it]

[after a goon is blown through a door for messing with a power cell]
Well, I think we've all learned an important safety lesson here.
I abhor violence, especially when it doesn't make me money.

[after blowing up and killing Durant]
This time, it's forever.
